attributes.comment:
My husband and I are adopting a little girl from China. The effort in preparing
paperwork and the expense of adoption will have a great reward in the end.
However, with word of the proposal to raise the cost associated with the
fingerprinting and I71-H, we are afraid that many will not pursue adoption. We are
afraid that the extra expense will cost much more that mere dollars. Perhaps it
will cost a child a new beginning in a loving home. A family may have a large
heart, but not a large purse. Adoption is a rewarding, yet expensive journey.
Please do not make the adoption process any harder than it already is, especially
now that waiting periods have been expanded. Many families, including our own,
will probably have to undergo the fingerprinting and I71-H process again. This will
mean another fee of around $600 on top of the fees already incurred. Raising the
fees may put excessive burdens on families so that they simply may not be able
to adopt. Please keep the children first and reconsider the raising of these fees.

Thank you in behalf of all orphaned and abandoned children everywhere.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Daphyne R. Southern
